lines.text: Doors closing by themselves. People talkin' to nuthin' and gettin' answers. I'm going back.
Back where?
To Mr. Benny. Ain't nuthin' like this ever happened there.
Six more inches and we'd all be singing 'Annie Doesn't Live Here Anymore.'
Pardon me, boss, but could I sort of inquire what we're going to the Carrington place for?
To look for a body.
Better look for one for me, too, 'cause the one I'm using now is numb.
[Two attractive woman stop a car by sitting right in the roadway]
Uh-oh! Danger ahead. Two of 'em.
What's that sound?

It's the waves. Angry waves. Day after day, night after night, they beat with savage fury against the black rocks below. For twenty years they've been calling... calling... calling to someone who never answers.
Just like the Pot of Gold program.
This young lady owes me for a taxi cab ride. I came here to collect it, she asked me up to this room, I heard her scream, and... walked into the middle of an Orson Welles broadcast.
So you admit there is a body.
Yes. I came over here to look for it.
Well, how did you know it was here?
She told me.
She? Who's she?
The dead girl.
Well, here, read it - or am I expecting too much?
Trying to make these policemen understand something is harder than doing it yourself.

[appearing suddenly on the stoop]
Good evening.

[startled]
Why don't you knock before you come out?
What else do you do around here besides wind clocks?
The Chinese Room will be yours, Miss Richards.
Oh, you're a doll.

[to Ann]
Well, this is just dandy. I travel seven thousand miles just to get away from Chinamen, and here I am with everything but a bowl of rice.
Where did you last see her?
She was sitting on a table in the hall and she hung my hat on a Chinaman's foot.
I'm not supposed to think - I'm from the city hall.
Where's your husband?
In the icebox.
Has he got the body with him?
Certainly. Under his overcoat.
You wouldn't, by any chance, be thinking you were a lamb chop?
Well, what are YOU doin' here?
If you'd've asked me that a second later, you'd have been talkin' to yourself.
Nobody leaves this room. Not even me. And that goes for the both of us.
Innocent men stay home nights. They don't hide in iceboxes. And they don't take dead bodies on boat rides.
Why did you kill her?
I didn't!
That's only ONE man's opinion.
I can prove it.
How?
Leave me alone in that room for a minute.
Ho-ho, I'm not THAT dumb.
Well, that's only one man's opinion, too.
Send for a straight jacket. Make it two - one for me.
There's a pickpocket in the joint! Whoever stole that witness, put her back!
I've been in politics ten years, and I've never seen anything as balled up as this is!
Why, you're all wet. Is it raining out? Oh, but you haven't been out. Can't be raining in. Well, if it has, it's all cleared up.
